[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The ASPERA-3 Processing and Archiving Facility (APAF) defines requirements for telemetry processing, data archiving, and distribution for scientific research.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: APAF enables telemetry ingestion, calibration, secure storage, and access for mission data users.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: APAF integrates with spacecraft telemetry, scientific archives, and research portals.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: APAF provides web dashboards, analytics tools, and data download utilities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: APAF runs on high-performance servers optimized for large-scale data processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: APAF supports REST APIs for interoperability with external analytics tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: APAF ensures secure data transfers using standard encryption protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: APAF optimizes storage for large datasets, ensuring efficient retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: APAF operates continuously with scheduled maintenance to ensure system stability.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: APAF adapts to mission needs, evolving data formats, and updated processing models.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: APAF connects to ESA and NASA archives for synchronized data access.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: APAF ingests, processes, and archives telemetry while enabling seamless data access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for scientists, research institutions, and mission analysts with technical expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: APAF depends on stable telemetry feeds, operational ground stations, and adherence to transmission protocols.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: APAF requires real-time spacecraft telemetry, compliance with ESA data policies, and archival infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Telemetry: Spacecraft data sent to ground stations.
Archive: Secure storage for mission data.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: APAF: ASPERA-3 Processing and Archiving Facility
NASA: National Aeronautics and Space Administration

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall ingest telemetry data and synchronize with ESA/NASA archives.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process telemetry into calibrated science products (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall archive mission datasets and enable retrieval through user portals (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide intuitive, customizable workflows for data access.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process telemetry data within 2 minutes.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 1,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The database shall securely store mission data and calibrated science outputs.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access control and fast queries.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow a modular, scalable architecture.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with ESAâ€™s data security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ESA and NASA data-sharing policies.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall meet ISO 27001 security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall dynamically scale with increased data volumes.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log all data transactions for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Validates telemetry processing, archival accuracy, and compliance with ESA/NASA policies.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, setup guides, API documentation, and compliance references.
[SEC] 5. References: ESA data policies, NASA data-sharing guidelines, and ISO 27001 documentation.
